snippet: The European Central Bank said lending to companies remained weak, while loans to households registered feeble growth.
abstract: European Central bank says lending to companies in euro zone remains weak, falling at annual rate of 1.8 percent in November; report could encourage expectations of interest-rate cut soon.
lead_paragraph: The European Central Bank said lending to companies remained weak, while loans to households registered feeble growth.

headline.seo: European Economy Remains Fragile, Data Shows
headline.main: Bank Lending in Euro Zone Slumped in November, Data Show
headline.print_headline: European Economy Is Still Showing Fragility
